properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 31 at 11:13PM AKST until January 2 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring along the coast.
Visibility will be near zero at times. Travel will be very
difficult to impossible. Inland areas will have wind chills to
45 below.

* WHERE...Chukchi Sea Coast.

* WHEN...Until 6 PM Thursday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 55 mph will cause
whiteout conditions in blowing snow and drifting snow along the
coast. Cold wind chills as low as 45 below zero will cause
frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin.
properties.instruction:
A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are
expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds
and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout
conditions, making travel extremely difficult.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IS CANCELLED
